org.jacktheclipper.frontend.service

Class SourceService

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jacktheclipper.frontend.service.SourceService

  • @Service
public class SourceService
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles all requests to the backend concerning sources. This includes e. g. adding them or checking which are available for a given user.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.lang.String backendUrl 
      private static org.slf4j.Logger log 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description
      SourceService() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addSource(Source source, java.util.UUID userId)
      Adds the source This does not make the source available to any existing organizational unit
      void deleteSource(java.util.UUID userId, java.util.UUID sourceId)
      Tells the backend to erase the source with the supplied UUID from the database
      java.util.List<Source> getAvailableSources(java.util.UUID userId)
      Gets the resources available to a user
      java.util.List<Source> recoverSources(java.util.List<Source> receivedSources, java.util.UUID userId)
      Uses the list of incomplete sources to return a list with complete ones The method is necessary since the Source class uses a #toString method that does not use all of its fields.
      void updateSource(java.util.UUID userId, Source source)
      Updates the source.

      • SourceService

        public SourceService()

    • Method Detail

      • getAvailableSources

        public java.util.List<Source> getAvailableSources(java.util.UUID userId)
        Gets the resources available to a user
        Parameters:
        userId - The id of the user for whom the available sources should be checked
        Returns:
        A list of the available sources for the specified user. It is empty if the user does not exist.

      • addSource

        public void addSource(Source source,
                      java.util.UUID userId)
        Adds the source This does not make the source available to any existing organizational unit
        Parameters:
        source - The source to add
        userId - The user performing this request. It is used by the backend to check permissions

      • recoverSources

        public java.util.List<Source> recoverSources(java.util.List<Source> receivedSources,
                                             java.util.UUID userId)
        Uses the list of incomplete sources to return a list with complete ones The method is necessary since the Source class uses a #toString method that does not use all of its fields.
        Parameters:
        receivedSources - A list of source, where only the id and name field is set
        userId - The user needed to access the list of sources in the backend
        Returns:
        A list of complete Source objects, where every source from the input list is included and has each of its fields set

      • deleteSource

        public void deleteSource(java.util.UUID userId,
                         java.util.UUID sourceId)
        Tells the backend to erase the source with the supplied UUID from the database
        Parameters:
        userId - The user attempting the deletion
        sourceId - The id of the source that should be deleted

      • updateSource

        public void updateSource(java.util.UUID userId,
                         Source source)
        Updates the source. This requires the source to have an id present. Otherwise this method will not work
        Parameters:
        userId - The id of the user doing the update
        source - The updated version of the source
